root: ^You come in here a lot, don't you?
^Yeah, I love the... Mirrors. They're so... Reflective.
^Why do you come in here so often?
^Well it's nice and quiet in here, away from the crowds.
^You need a lot of time to think, it seems.
^Don't we all? Why do you seem so worried about it?
^Because I think you're lying to me.
^Something you dno't want us to see. The other guests wouldn't think twice about it.
^All they see is you wandering around the park.
^But I see it. That gleam of stress in your eye. Why don't you tell me what you're so worried about?

s: ^There's a parallel universe in the mirror.

Choice2: ^I disagree. I already know what you found in that mirror. I'm the only other one that knows. Tell me what you saw.
^There's a whole other world through that mirror. And, well, there was a murder, too.
next: ^Who do you think broke the timeline apart?
^You try so hard to play detective yet you can't even figure out the answer to that question.
^Do you know how long it took to figure out how to split a timeline?
^I had to elarn how to separaet a single day in it's own isolated world.
^A whole day, ripped from this unverse and brought into it's own.
^All the grief they feel, repeaetd over and over. No "tomorrow" to run off to.
^Their every hour passing alongside ours, not knowing they have no future.
^WHen you removed that day from the world, it broke. The rules of reality changed.
^People morphed into animals and objects - their matter intertwined.
^Children are screaming out for their parents, just begging to be free.
^Whatever you wnated from this can't be worth the pain they're going through.
^We're all suffering. I wanted to save everyone from that.
^You murder the Ring Master. Don't act like you're a hero here.
^You haven't saved anyone from suffering. You've made their suffering worse.
^Reginald and I grew up together. He went into business when I went into medicine.
^He always supported me, he even funded my research after his first big trade deal.
^But no matter how hard we worked, everything we did was rejected. We never put a single pill on a pharmacy shelf.
^Reginald's life was the opposite of mine. He couldn't stop getting big deals approved.
^He kept growing richer and richer. And I was happy for my friend. I was proud of his success.
^My medicine was going to save lives, you know. We worked for years, studying relentlessly.
^And we created a supplement that slowed the deterioration of the human body.
^People would have been able to live twice as long, maybe even three times with enough work.
^And in that time we could suppress illness and viruses. People would live longer and better lives.
^So, I reached out to my old friend. But Reginald saw our work and the lives we were going to save. And he said "no."
^"No"! To me and my team. The audacity!
^He took his fortune and started this carnival. He never cared about a single life.
^And if he wouldn't let me save lives, why should I give him the right to live?
^So I killed him, and by doing so created a universe where he never existed.
^No one has to remember him, and he can't hurt anyone ever again.
^Sure, Steven might be a little confused about becoming the Ring Master.
^But don't be so high on your morals. Those who hate life don't deserve to live.
Choice3: ^You can't let your anger affect the decisions you make.
Choice4: ^That's what they always say. But it was safe. I know it was.
^Everyone was just too scared to give us a chance.
^I'm sorry they did, but you can't let that get to you. That doesn't justify any of this.
DONE: ^I made my decision. And so long as another soul steps through that mirror, no one will ever know.
^Everyone will be better off for it, too. Never having to worry about that selfish, egotistical, good-for-nothing Ring Master.
^I never thought a journalist would be such a nuisance. Goodbye, and enjoy the universe you've spent so much time exploring.
